revised_title: John Theodore Hewitt's Life and Contributions to Chemistry
tldr: This article is a biographical memoir of John Theodore Hewitt, a prominent chemist born in 1868. It covers his early life, education, and career, highlighting his experiences at various institutions and his contributions to the field of chemistry. Hewitt is known for his work on chlorinated phenylhydrazines, arylazophenol hemihydrates, and his time in Germany and England as a chemist and educator.
